intro: Baseonema multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered baseonema, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences and showy, pentagonal petals. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and has fibrous roots. Its botanical features make it of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
